solution_line_template: The total number of people transported in the first trip is {passengers_oneway} one way + {passengers_return} on the return trip = <<{passengers_oneway}+{passengers_return}={first_trip_total_passengers}>>{first_trip_total_passengers} people.

If the train made three more round trips that day carrying the same number of passengers in each trip as the first, it carried a total of {additional_round_trips}*{first_trip_total_passengers} = <<{additional_round_trips}*{first_trip_total_passengers}={additional_trips_total_passengers}>>{additional_trips_total_passengers} in all three round trips.

In total, the train carried {first_trip_total_passengers}+{additional_trips_total_passengers} = <<{first_trip_total_passengers}+{additional_trips_total_passengers}={total_passengers_transported}>>{total_passengers_transported} people over all its trips that day
